reviews.text: Not many choices for familes with young children in Sri Lanka as the rooms for the beach hotels generally only take a couple or are adults only. The Blue Water has a very beautiful location, right on the beach with a view of the ocean, and an elegant if slightly brackish pool, but the rate of $195 US we paid for a small room with 2 single beds and a cot was not worth it. The restaurant is also quite expensive. I've stayed at the Cinamon Grand in Colombo and the food is so much better, and cheaper. Unfortunately, if you only have 3 nights and don't want to drive further south, there is not much else to choose from.
reviews.title: Not worth the money unless you get a suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from the Blue Water, this hotel is one of the best all inclusive we have stayed in. The staff are very friendly & nothing is to much trouble. The pool area is very large with plenty of sunbeds to go round, The food in the main buffet restaurant is great even if you were a fussy eater you would find something to your taste. If you are thinking of going to Blue Water & you want to do some trips look for Sam he will either be on the beach or at the front of the hotel he also works for bens tours. We did a couple of trips with him I will post some photos of him in the next couple of days. We did one overnight stay to Kandy & another overnight to Yala national park we had a fantastic time on each trip thanks to Sam, you can e mail him on [--] if you prefer to make arrangements before you leave the uk he will be delighted to hear from you. If you are thinking of booking the Blue Water do not hestitate you will have a great time.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel Fantastic Holiday

reviews.text: The rack rate is definitely something to consider (full board at 200USD/nt incl. taxes superior deluxe i think with a hot tub) as the value equation works well if you are capable of stuffing your self to no end at buffets...my guess is that this habit is changing even for the most indulgent local or tourist.
reviews.title: breezy beach balcony dreams

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the place was fully booked! so get in early when you want to go! there are supposedly day rooms but that would depend on avail. its easy enough to go for the lunch buffet and have a swim etc. even if you're passing through.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a relaxing break

reviews.text: the breakfast buffet was very good! the dinner buffet was OK - at 28USD a head it was overpriced in my view. battered crab at the dinner rocked!
reviews.title: Good Place , Better Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Blue water Wadduwa was great hotel, you walked in and thought wow. Service was also very good, staff very helpful, friendly. Huge pools and attentive staff. We were lucky enough to have a a delux room which was very nice, with an ocean view which spacious and new. Recommend that standard rooms really need a major upgrade though from what we saw. The buffet food was just ok , compared to the other hotels i stayed in on my tour teh food here was balnd and did not stand out for me. It was very hard to get a nice Srilankan Meal. A hidden jem we foudn was the Fishermans Villa two doors down to the left while walking on the beach. Fantastic local food with a good seafood selection and great prices. The spa is also incredible.. do try it....
reviews.title: Great hotel with good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was with some trepidation that we booked the Blue Water, the price seemed too good to be true and we had decided not to go long haul again after three Maldive holidays. The transfer from the airport was not particularly smooth, the Sri Lankan traffic was a bit chaotic to say the least and we were all a bit tired and hot after an eleven hour night flight.
reviews.title: Simply, the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impressions were of a large, airy hotel much as you'd find anywhere in the tropics, but as we settled in we came to realise that this hotel was a bit special, a cut above the rest. And really it could be summed up with one word, Quality. The food is first class with a huge selection of dishes for nearly all meals, the staff are just wonderful, always smiling and they couldn't do enough for you. The rooms were kept clean with a daily service and a nightly turn-down as well (the same as in the better Maldivian resorts). The hotel grounds were lovely, with plenty of shade from the palm trees to keep off the fierce midday sun (unless you're British of course, in which case you could grill quite nicely in an unshaded patch!).
reviews.title: 5 star location and staff the rest would be 3 star

reviews.text: Whilst sunbathing in the grounds of the hotel you will be entertained by the Palm Squirrels that live in the palm trees (funnily enough). They look like, and are wrongly called, chipmunks and are very cute, even taking food from your hand once they get to trust you. You may even have them visiting your balcony too. There are also quite a few white Herons in the grounds too, that will come and stare at you until you throw them a morsel or two!
reviews.title: My other home and friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before we started our holiday, our tour operator, Thomson, sent us details of the trips that were available. They were somewhat expensive, daytrips starting around £85 each going up to around £400 for a 5 day excusrion. We had decided to do a day trip to Kandy, taking in the Elephant orphanage at Pinnawala as well. However, once we arrived at the Blue Water we discovered the hotel's hidden asset, Ruchi. He isn't employed by the hotel, in fact, isn't allowed on the premises, but he is one of the people who can make your holiday one to remember. We booked two tours with him. The first was a 2 day trip to Kandy and the Elephant orphanage amongst other attractions. Nothing was too much trouble. For instance, we insisted that we went with just one other couple with whom we became friends and this was no problem for him. The other trip was a 1 day excursion to the Dutch Fort at Galle. This took us through an area which was savagely devastated when the tsunami hit on Boxing day 2004. Although the area has recovered from this, there are still ruined houses which will never be occupied and there are countless graves along the roadside. Very sobering, as are the memorials to this disaster.
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful - we can't wait to go back.

reviews.text: Just got back as we stuck a week on the Maldives at the end of staying at the BlueWater . We had read so many conflicting reports about this hotel on TripAdvisor that we were very concerned as to what we could expect but from the moment that we arrived to the normal welcome ( drinks / cold towels etc ) our previous negative thoughts had gone ! Yes the rooms could do with a makeover especially the bathrooms . Yes, the travel time from the airport is long. Yes the traffic is crazy but ,HEY you are in Sri Lanka for a holiday experience ...... it aint Cornwall thats for sure !!
reviews.title: great value holiday.. but go with a good frame of mind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found that the service level around the hotel and pool area was great.... this has a very large area around the pool so its takes the bar staff a little bit longer to get around .
reviews.title: Brilliant Bluewater-a wonderful holiday.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at all times was very acceptable and the Chefs are very willing to do any extras that you require . The restaurant is aircon but you can eat outside if you prefer .
reviews.title: Excellent holiday at Blue Water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went on a couple of organised tours which was arranged by Ruchi as I had previously emailed him prior to our arrival. Great guy, has a great command of Sri Lanka history and culture . This was the first time that we have ever used a " beach rep " on holiday before but the reviews that this guy got on TripAdvisor were and are truly amazing !!
reviews.title: Budget Hotel in Budget Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all , we had a fantastic time at the Blue Water , dont take any books as there is a large library, and there are good quantities of "bathroom stuff". The entertainment is enjoyable but low key except the duo who were brilliant . However most people seem to go to bed quite early so it is never noisy .. only when Brandon gets hold of the guitar !!
reviews.title: Wonderfully relaxed hotel
Lovely hotel & beach, location so-so
reviews.text: The Blue Water is a sprawling new resort in between Colombo and Bentota, about 35 kms to either place.

The resort pretty much has it all, a huge pool with separate kids, shallow and deep sections, a spa (didn't use it), fitness centre (well-equipped), a squash court,etc. The beach is great, and swimming in the sea wasn't a problem even in April, the fag end of the season. You can watch the fisherman bring in the catch every morning. It was also nice to go for a jog by the water - the dogs ignore you if you ignore them.
reviews.title: Won't get enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are compact but sufficient. Every room has a balcony with a view of the sea. The ground floors rooms have limited view but compensate by giving direct access to the pool and the beach beyond. There is one large restaurant with buffet meals, and an open-air coffee shop/snack lounge plus a bar. Service is pretty good and friendly overall.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only con is that there is not much activity around the resort so it's great for an all-inclusive package (which most of the guests seemed to be on) rather for outside activities and sight-seeing. For those not on an all-inclusive package, the restaurants aren't TOO expensive (dinner costs around US$25-30) and the buffet restaurant has a different dinner theme every day so it doesn't get boring. But still, for people who want to try different eateries, it could get a little stifling.
reviews.title: Our most relaxing and enjoyable holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Water sports and good restaurants/cafes are at Bentota-Hikkaduwa-Galle, which are 1 to 2 hours away (road travel in Sri Lanka is pretty slow). We tried to find decent restaurants around the hotel, but that was pretty difficult. The ones we went to (including one right next to the hotel) were pretty average.
reviews.title: An amazing honeymoon!
